intro: Aidema microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited aidema, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Aidema microcarpa is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
